That's what God tells us. Listen for the still, small voice. Be still and know that I am God. As we get into His presence, and we're bowing down our ear to understand His will, but then notice what the psalmist says, turn to the book of Psalms, if you will, in Psalm 86, I want you to see what is said here. And I hope again, that it would help you this morning, because as I am spending time in His word, as I'm bowing down mine ear to hear and to understand, and to learn what the will of God is, that will then shape my prayer life, because I am to pray according to His will. And we know that if we pray according to His will, that He's going to answer. And I see prayers answered in my life, and I'm encouraged, and I'm strengthened, and my faith is increased, and I'm drawn closer to Him, and I'm praying more, and I'm seeking Him more. And it's a wonderful result, a product of this privilege and this promise that He's given us of prayer. But I want you to notice what the psalmist says in Psalm 86. We read what the wise man said in Proverbs about us bowing down our ear to His word. But notice what the psalmist says in verse one of Psalm 86. "'Bow down thine ear, O Lord. "'Hear me, for I am poor and needy.'" We want God to bow down His ear to hear our prayers, but we must first bow down our ear to understand His will. And as I bow down mine ear to understand His will, and I pray according to His will, I can have confidence that He's gonna bow down His ear to hear my prayer and to answer my prayer. For indeed, I can relate to the psalmist, I am poor and needy, amen. And we find that as God has given us this privilege and this promise of prayer, and He wants us to have confidence, but really when we dig in and we understand what He's packaging for us and how He's giving us and providing this truth for us, He's really leading us to a place where I'm developing a closer walk with Him, just a closer walk with Him. Listen, this ought to be not only the expectation, but it ought to be the desire of every child of God to be closer drawn to my Savior, that I would be in His presence. See, I don't want to just be a nominal Christian. I don't want to just be a surface flounder around, just kind of convenient Christian. I want to be all in. I want to be close to my God. And I have the promise that He's given that if we draw nigh to Him, He'll draw nigh to us. And when we understand this truth of prayer, it's not just so that we can give our whole list of wants and whatever. No, no, no, we begin to say, I'm praying according to His will. How often I would challenge myself and I would challenge you this morning to evaluate your prayer life and see how much of it is according to His will. I mentioned before about praying out loud. I mentioned also about recording yourself praying. I'm not sure if anyone's ever taken me up on that suggestion. I've done it personally. I've taken my phone and I've started record and I've prayed out loud. If I could go back and hear. Why? It helps me to be able to evaluate, am I praying according to His will? Am I rambling? Am I just all over the place? Is there some direction in my prayer? I wouldn't do it every week, personally. It was convicting, but it was helpful because we're to pray according to His will. And as we pray according to His will, we have this great promise. And as we see God answer prayer, listen, I hope it works this way in your life, it works this way in my life. When I see God answer prayer, I desire to pray more. You see God answer prayer, and you see God answer prayer, and you're drawn closer to Him, and you're studying His word, and you're learning His will, and you're praying according to His will, and you're seeing Him answer prayer, and you're just drawn closer and closer and closer to God. We find that we're to walk with Him. Enoch had this testimony. He walked with God, and he was not, for God took him. Noah was a man that walked with God. We could begin to look at other examples in the Word of God of those that walked with God. And we find this morning that we're to have confidence in prayer. There's a condition that is stated, but what thrills my soul is this product, this closer walk with God. And I hope this morning that it's not only something that we can expect to be the product, but it is something that I truly desire, that you truly desire, a closer walk with Thee. Let's pray together. Father, we love You. We thank You so much for loving us. We thank You for the privilege of being able to gather together this morning. We thank You for the truth of Your Word. God, we thank You that You're a God who hears and answers prayer. We're thankful that You're able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think. We thank You for the countless promises that You've given us in Your Word with regard to answered prayer. We thank You for the multitudes of examples that You've given us in Your Word of You answering prayer, of responding to those of Your children that have prayed with those words, I have heard Thy prayer. God, I pray that You'd help us to understand this morning the great privilege that is ours to pray. I pray, God, that You'd help us to understand this morning this promise that You've given to us and the condition that is stated with regard to the according to His will. God, I pray that as we desire to be people of prayer, men and women of prayer, boys and girls of prayer, that God, we would seek Your will through Your Word so that we would truly pray according to Your will. God, I pray that as we see You answer, see You work and move, as we pray according to Your will and You answer in mighty ways, God, it's my prayer that it would cause us to draw closer to Thee. I pray that that would be the desire of every individual that's present this morning. Lord, if there's one that's not sure of heaven, they've never trusted the Lord Jesus Christ as their personal Savior. We know that it is Your will that they would be saved. It is our prayer this morning that You would save them, Lord, that they would understand that the Holy Spirit of God would convict them of their sin and of Christ's righteousness and of judgment to come. They would understand that they're a sinner and there's only one Savior, His name is Jesus. He lived a perfect and sinless life. He went to a cruel cross. He bled and He died. He was buried in a borrowed tomb and He rose conquering sin, death, and the grave. There's one here, one on livestream that's not sure of heaven. God, would You save them today? Would You help them to call out to Thee? Would they take the promise that's been given, for whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved? Father for every child of God, every one that's here that's been saved, that's been born again, I pray that we desire to have a closer walk with Thee. Lord, that You'd help us to get into Your Word, dig into Your Word to know Your will and then to pray according to Thy will. In these few moments of invitation, we pray that You'd have Your will in way, that You'd work as only You can and we'll be careful to give You the honor and glory for it's in Christ's name we pray.
